lead_paragraph: Officials in New Orleans hope to land the N.F.L. draft. The Greater New Orleans Sports Foundation sent a letter to Commissioner Roger Goodell seeking to stage the annual draft, which is in April, and turn it into a weeklong celebration, including a Mardi Gras-style parade and civic events involving retired N.F.L. players.New York has played host to the draft since 1965. It is scheduled to be at Radio Music City Hall next year, where it was held the past two years.
